passages.text: ... capacity constraints to relieve in 2026F

Action: Maintain Buy but raise TP to CNY220, implying \(18\%\) upside Shennan Circuits (SC) reported strong 2Q25 results on 26 August after market close, with revenue / earnings recording \(30\% /43\%\) y-y growth, beating our estimates by \(11\% /63\%\) on stronger PCB shipments and margin expansion. As one of the leading AI PCB/IC substrate suppliers in China, we think SC is a key beneficiary of China's AI chip development, led by its long-term partnership with top AI/tech customers, i.e., Huawei (unlisted) and Cambricon (688256 CH, Not rated). Meanwhile, SC is making solid progress in the global AI PCB market, as overseas market growth accelerated to \(47\%\) y-y (vs \(29\%\) y-y in FY24) and contributed \(37\%\) of total revenue in 1H25. In view of the robust demand for AIPCB and IC substrate (primarily for China customers), we raise FY25- 27F revenue and earnings forecasts by \(3.5 - 12\%\) and \(13.2 - 29.3\%\) , respectively. We maintain our Buy rating and raise TP to CNY220, based on 42x (previously 27x) FY26F EPS of CNY5.19, in line with the China PCB sector's FY25 median P/E but higher than the FY26F median (32x), as we think the company's IC substrate business exposure to domestic AI chip leaders justifies the valuation premium. The stock is trading at 36x FY26F EPS.

Due to the robust demand for AI PCB (for optical transceivers, network switches and AI servers), SC's PCB factory is running at a high utilization rate, which is positive for margin expansion, but would threaten further revenue upside, in our view. The company strives to increase capacity through technical upgrades on its existing factories and expanding new production lines in Thailand (starting trial production in 3Q25), Nantong IV (starting trial production in 4Q25). We think its capacity constraints should ease in 2026F, leading to further upside for the PCB segment. We raise FY25- 27F PCB segment revenue forecasts by \(7.3 - 24.7\%\) , representing a \(24.5\%\) CAGR and \(61\%\) revenue contribution in FY27F.

IC substrate segment margin recovery in 2H25F and 2026 with better demand SC's IC substrate segment margin reached \(15.1\%\) in 1H25, up from trough levels in 2H24 (GPM: \(10.7\%\) ) on better demand for BT- substrate. As well, its ABF- substrate factory, with a narrowed loss margin in 1H25, is ramping up on schedule. We think the IC substrate segment margin will continue to improve with better demand from domestic AI chip and memory customers, as it is still far off the normal level ( \(25\% +\) ).

Shennan Circuits Co Ltd (SCC) is one of the leading PCB (Printed Circuit Board) manufacturer headquartered in Shenzhen, Guangdong China. Main business of SCC include PCB, IC substrate, and PCB assembly.

Our target price of CNY220.00 is based on 42x 2026F EPS of CNY19.9, higher than its historical median P/E of 35x, as we think the valuation premium is justified by its IC substrate business expense to China leading AI chip customers. The benchmark index is CSI300.

Downside risks include: 1) delay in 5G network ramp- up in China; 2) further sanctions on the telecom value chain companies in China by the US; and 3) intensified competition in the PCB market in China

SCC is a leading telecom equipment producer, which shares social responsibility by offering infrastructure products for telecom network. The telecom equipment manufacturing requires land, equipment and other materials which may have impacts to environment, while factory automation may help to improve environmental scores. Corporate governance needs improvement in terms of shareholder return, etc.

We raise our FY25F- 27F revenue estimates by \(3.5 - 12\%\) to reflect stronger- than- expected demand for AI PCB products. We also raise FY25- 27F GPM by 1.1- 2.0pp to reflect better price and margins from AI PCB product upgrades, as well as higher utilization rates from the IC substrate sector. As a result, we raise our FY25- 27F earnings by \(13.2 - 29.3\%\) .
Fig.1: Shennan Circuits - earnings forecast revisions
Source: Company data, Nomura estimate

We raise FY25- 27F PCB segment revenue estimates by \(7.3 - 24.7\%\) to reflect the stronger demand for AI PCB products. Meanwhile, we lower IC substrate segment revenue forecasts by \(6.1 - 18.2\%\) , as we think the company's capacity ramp- up in the high- end product segment (ABF- substrate) takes longer time than we expected.
Fig.2:Shennan Circuits-earnings forecast by segment
Source: Company data, Nomura estimate

Our FY25- 27F revenue forecasts are \(3 - 8\%\) higher than the WIND consensus, as we are more positive on the company's production capacity expansion. Our FY25- 27F earnings are also \(4 - 18\%\) higher than the WIND consensus, as we are more positive on SC's margin expansion in the short term.
Fig.3:Shennan Circuits-Nomura vs consensus estimates
Source: Company data, WIND, Nomura estimates

Our new target price of CNY220 is based on 42x 2026F EPS of CNY5.19, in line with the China PCB sector's FY25F median P/E, but higher than the FY26F median P/E of 32x and the company's historical median P/E of 35x. We think the valuation premium is justified by its IC substrate business exposure to China's leading AI chip customers.
Downside risks include: 1) delays in 5G network ramp-up in China; 2) further sanctions on telecom value chain companies in China by the US; and 3) intensified competition in the PCB market in China.
Fig. 4: Shennan Circuits - 12-month forward P/E band
Source: Company data, Bloomberg Finance L.P., Nomura estimates
Fig. 5: Shennan Circuits - 12-month forward P/B band
Source: Company data, Bloomberg Finance L.P., Nomura estimates
